text: Sample from 750 ml bottle at M-Cafe, vintage 2016. Deep red with little head. Aroma has lots of sour cherries, sour notes, acetic and mild lactic. Taste is similar, big cherry notes, sour base beer, some malts.

Bottle 0.75l sample at Ratebeer Belgian Winter Gathering 2017 Antwerp, Belgium at Beerlovers Bar 25.02.2017. Thanks everybody for sharing great beers! Pour it red color with no head. Aroma cherry, something funky. Taste nice cherry thingling, light sweetness, dry on the back, medium sourness, after taste really red fruits, medium to full body, creamy, thick feel, lively, long finish. Good!
Świetne piwo, jak owocowy lambik. Wiśnie bardzo wyraźne, całkiem sporo Brettów, dużo lacto. Wyraźnie kwaśne, wytrawne. Klasa.
Butelka, bottlesharing w Piwotece. Aromat bardzo lambikowy, przyjemne pestki wiśni. Smak lekko kwaśny, dosyc wytrawny, minimalna słodycz ale jednak brakuje w nim głębi. Nadal jest to świetne piwo.
Geproefd @ RBBWG2017. Kleur is roos-rood, met donkerdere wolkjes. Geur is op en top kriek en zuur. Het smaakt zoals het ruikt: krieken en zuur. Op het einde een licht droge afdronk.

Bottle share at RBBWG 2017, thanks for sharing.
Anno 2016.
Couleur rosâtre, col rosé actif et retombant vite.
Arôme est complexe avec de belles effluves de cerises et léger fleur de cerisier avec un léger rétro terreux. Le côté malté est plutôt discret.
Palais est finement fruité, cerise avec un bon caractère terreux rappelant presque une effet de framboises. Le tout est sec et bien pétillant avec une alternance entre douceur fruitée et léger acidité-aigrelet des cerises. Garde le mérite de ne pas tomber dans lusage surfait de jus de cerise.

Top-fermented beer with sour Schaarbeekse cherries; intended to celebrate the 500th birthday of Andreas Vesalius, a prominent 16th-century anatomist. Bottle shared at RBBWG. Loose, bubbly, off-white head, quickly dissipating; hazy deep fuchsia colour with fiery ruby red hue. Aroma bursts with fresh sour cherries, raspberries, cassis, lime zest, almond, biscuit crumbs, sourdough, white bread, rosé wine, pear peel, cake. Very crisp, vividly fruity flavor, tons of sour cherries bringing a refreshing lemony acidic hint, surrounded by estery suggestions of redcurrant, raspberry and gooseberry all around, a bit more mellow and fruit yoghurty in the middle, tad soapy, smooth on a bready and lightly caramelly, rounded malt sweet backbone, cherry stones adding drying tannins in the finish while the sour cherry tartness adds further drought; juicy and utterly quenching tail. Nice, crisp, to the point, not needlessly sugared (or Stevia-ed), honest and free of technical flaws: this is not just the best Vlier beer I ever had by far, it is the first one exceeding merely regional significance. Will definitely revisit if I come across another bottle.

Sampled at the RBBWG2017 . Thnx for sharing, everyone ! Pours rather unclear purple/pinkred. Small white head. Smell is wet cherries, full (lactic?) sourness. Taste is full, fruity, sour. Bit dry. Full fruityness. Very nice !

Small pink rim over deep cyclamen-red beer. Superb sour cherry nose, and spiced wood, cinnamon. Sweet-sourish flavour, very fruity character with pure sour cherries. Light body, also thanks to acidthinning. Excellent! Nose is out of the charts.
750ml bottle pours out amber pink topped with small head. Nose is nice berries a well balanced tartness and sweet. Taste is more of the nice tart berries and funk.

The new batch, to be sold starting this summer. I was told by the beer this is somewhat sweeter than last. Also 1? lower abv. Very cool dark looks, not so clear, like it. Rich cherry aroma, but deep, almost chocolate. Not the most complex as base beer but cherry properly adds character. Good sourness but not a lambic kriek. Liked it a lot! (15cl pour at the sour beer tasting event at M-Cafe Leuven)

Gusher pour, red and ruby with lots of fiz. Needs 2 minutes to settle down and offer a full cherry offering. Sweet cloying sugars stick to the palate, tangy sch. kriek which are full sweet-sour, fermented lambic-fruit and date/figs.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks beerandbeyond. Beautiful dark red with a pink head. Aroma with lots of cherries, marzipan, a lactic hint and a medicinal note. Sourish-sweetish flavor, a bit lactic, with lots of juicy cherries. Slick and rounded. Lovely stuff. A great surprise from a brewery Ive never heard about.
ath the m cafe along with Yves and benny dark red colored body with a pink head and with a fruity sour malt aroma a fruity sweet cherry sour bitter dry taste with a sour bitter finish

75cl bottle, shared between 5 at the Tenth Shrewsbury Bottle Share Dec 14, brought by me, thanks to Jef Verstraete. Pours plum-red with a lovely pinkish head. Aroma is cherry pips. Taste is a wincing sour cherry pie with a complex fruity character thats hard to put into words. So hugely impressed by this I will endeavour to hunt out another bottle on my return to Belgium.
Shared with wim and benny at M café leuven. Nice red colored beer. Cherry aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sour sweet cherry ending sour dry.

0.75 litre bottle: BBD 4th Dec 2016. Shared between five on 8th Dec 2014. Cheers Mat for this unexpected delight. Pours a Victoria Plum purple colour with a pink froth as a head. Tart and sour from the start, loads of cherries and then more sour cherries, yet it was drinkable and even though sour is the word I am using it had a smoothness to its sharpness if you can grasp what I am trying to say. Anyway I do not usually like kriek beers, sour or sweet, but this was a lovely beer and I may well revisit the fruit beer scene when next in Belgium because I enjoyed this so much.
Tap at M-Café in Leuven. Deep red colour with thin layer of pink foam. Sweet/sour with a lot of sour cherries. Very good fruit beer.

From tap and from bottle at M Café

Nose full of sour cherries, with some hints of vanilla.
Continues in the taste, with a slight touch of bitterness from the cherry pit. Elegant, complex and refreshing.

Bottle, an extra from JefVerstraete. Thanks man! Pour the darkest of red imaginable with a tiny pinkish head. Nose has intense cherries, some vanilla and light funk. Taste is very intense, loads and loads of cherries, some almonds and marzipan with a discreet funk. Really well made stuff!

Thanks to Bursprak! Pours a deep red with a pink head - good looking SOB! Aroma of deep ripe cherries, almonds, some subtle funk, vanilla, sweet oaky notes, almost sweet red grapes, cherry wine and cherry sauce. The taste is quite sour and has more sour cherries along with a weak lactic note. Also some sweet oak which bring some vanilla. Slight funk and weak red wine/cherry wine notes to this as well. Very nice and different kriek!

75 cl bottle thanks to Erik. Pours clear, dark, deep red with a big, short lasting, pink head. Aroma has lots of dark cherries, cherry sauce, cherry wine marzipan, almonds, hints of vanilla, slight tartness and leather. Taste is much more tart and sparkling. Very fruity still, but more vinegar and. Taste is actually overwhelmed by the high, but nice carbonation. ends off pretty sour. Again body is very sparkling with a high carbonation. Alcohol is very well hidden. This is good stuff!

Bottle. Thanks Bursprak! Pours dark dark red with a pink fuzzy shortlasting head. Aromas of dark cherries, grain, slight leather, almonds. Taste is dark sweet cherries, slight horseblanket, almonds, vanilla, slight vinegar. Very nice!

25/X/14 - 75cl bottle @ The Autumn Gathering formerly known as RBBAG Mons (Gent) - BB: 4/XII/16 (2014-1254) Thanks to JefVerstraete for sharing the bottle!
Clear deep purple beer, huge crackling fizzy aery deep pink head, dissipates quickly, non adhesive. Aroma: warm cherries (from a jar), cherry jam, sourish, some chlorine. MF: lots of carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty sour, lots of sour cherries, pretty bitter, some tannins, cherry pie, bit of marzipan, nice stuff. Aftertaste: lots of cherries, sour, some tannins, probably from the cherry pits and skin.

Clear dark red colour, pink head. Aroma of cherries, very fruity, light sour, cherry pips. Fruity sour flavour, cherry, warm cherry sauce, peach. Finish malts, cherry, sour, citric acid, candy and almond. Nice!!!
(From 75cL bottle @ TAGFKARM (sorry Prince), Gent 2014. Thanks for sharing, JefVerstraete!)

75cl, at 8.5%Vol, as Vesalius, new exclusive brew Anno 2014, thx alot to Tim for sharing!, very complex sour Kriek, fruity and slightly sour/woody, very balanced, cloudy, small head, top class!, What a (fruity) revelation!

Thank you JefVerstraete! A fairly sizable portion from 750 ml. bottle consumed @ The Tasting formerly known as Mons RBBAG I (2014). BBF 04/12/2016. GUSHER. Appearance is astonishing deep purple, radiant fruit with a sadly instantly fizzing away super-dark pink head. Nose is full of cherry pits, reminiscent of Glühwein spices, reminiscent of warmed up kriek-juice (beer was cold obv. but smell still reminded me of this). Taste is thick kriek juice, almost concentrate with lots of pits, leaves & Glühwein spices, super juicy, near faint metallic minor note in the back. Thick juice-body, little carbonation. About as fruity as a beer can get, very lovely even if I cannot shake the feeling that this simply would have been better & with the necessary complexity + depth.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2016 Draught @ M Café, Leuven. Dark red colour, pink foam. Soft carbonation. Foam disappears quickly. Complex fruit beer. Very fruity, sour cherry, almond, green apple. Very well balanced. Tart with light sweet notes. This is very good, the best non-lambic fruit beer I ever tried! Unfortunatly this is a limited edition with only 400 bottles available. Buy it, it is very good!
